function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of statistical models for virus viability analysis may lead to inaccurate predictions and conclusions.","Impact":"Misunderstanding of virus viability could lead to ineffective disease control measures and increased transmission.","Mitigation":"Use multiple statistical models, validate results with experimental data, and consider real-world virus transmission dynamics.","Technologies":"Statistical software for regression analysis, data visualization tools, and experimental validation equipment.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Research team, public health organizations, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Inaccurate parametrization of the relationship between relative humidity (RH) and droplet size could lead to misinterpretation of aerosol behavior and transmission dynamics.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of aerosol behavior could lead to ineffective control measures and increased risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Validate parametrization with experimental data, consider real-world aerosol behavior, and use multiple sources of data.","Technologies":"Aerosol simulation software, experimental equipment for droplet size measurement, and data visualization tools.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Research team, public health organizations, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of the relationship between RH and absolute humidity (AH) could lead to errors in humidity control measures and disease transmission mitigation strategies.","Impact":"Inaccurate humidity control measures could lead to increased risk of disease transmission and ineffective mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Validate the relationship with experimental data, consider real-world humidity dynamics, and consult experts in aerosol transmission.","Technologies":"Humidity sensors, climate control systems, and experimental equipment for humidity measurement.","People":"Engineers, architects, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Building management, public health organizations, and government agencies."}]}
